title: Willian reveals he wants to stay at Chelsea and rules out move back to Brazil
text:
Chelsea forward Willian has reiterated his desire to stay at Stamford Bridge and ruled out a move back to Brazil.

Willian's current deal runs out at the end of the season and the forward is in negotiations with the Blues over extending his six-year stay in west London.

The 31-year-old was asked if he'd considering returning to Corinthians, the club where he started his career, but says his sole aim was to remain a Chelsea player.

Willian says he's determined to extend his stay at Chelsea beyond the end of this season

Willian's current deal expires in July and he's in talks with Chelsea over a new contract

Willian has earned the trust of Frank Lampard and made 11 appearances so far this season

'Of course when you talk about Corinthians, the club that launched me, I have a great affection, he told Esporte Interativo. 'But honestly, I don't think about returning to Brazil.

'I think I have a lot of wood to burn here in Europe. I have a market.

'I'm very happy here at Chelsea. Of course my contract is ending now, at the end of the season it's over. But I'm happy at Chelsea and I plan to stay here.'

Willian: Chelsea stats Appearances: 303 Goals: 54 Assists: 54 Honours: Europa League (1), Premier League (2), FA Cup (1), League Cup (1)

Just a few weeks ago, Willian spoke about his future at Chelsea and said he was reluctant to move, with his family settled in London.

'From my side, I want to stay,' he told the Evening Standard.

'I have one year left and I want to stay because I like to play for Chelsea.

'I love this club, I love to live in London and my family loves it here. I have been here six years already so everything is perfect for me.

'Of course [there is more I want to do at Chelsea], win the Champions League!

'I want to win more titles here, I want to play more games, to score more goals so everything that I can do, I will try hard to do.'
description: Chelsea forward Willian has reiterated his desire to stay at Stamford Bridge, with his current deal at the club set to expire at the end of the season, while ruling out a move back to Brazil.
